content.webTitle: Key points of the learning disability white paper

fields.headline: Key points of the learning disability white paper
fields.bodyText: The white paper, Valuing People: A New Strategy for Learning Disability for the 21st Century, seeks to underpin the government's "new vision" for people with learning disabilities by confirming four "key principles" of rights, independence, choice and inclusion. Key elements are:  An end to the last long-stay hospitals.  A five-year programme to modernise local council day services.  A new national learning disability information centre and helpline in conjunction with charity Mencap.  A national forum for people with learning disabilities.  A learning disability task force.  Specialist local services for people with severe and challenging behaviour and integrated facilities for children with severe disabilities and complex needs.  An extension of eligibility to "directs payments", a scheme which allows service users to choose and purchase their own care. New funds promised are:  A learning disability development fund of up to £100m over the next two years. This will be spent on modernising day centres, helping people move from long-stay hospitals to more appropriate accommodation in the community, developing specialist local services for adults with severe, challenging behaviour as well as integrated facilities for children with severe disabilities and complex needs.  An implementation support fund, worth £6m over three years, to fund new advocacy services as well as the learning disability information centre and helpline.  Extra funds are also promised for self-advocacy organisations. For the first time, national objectives will be established for quality and performance monitoring of learning disabilities services. These objectives aim to provide clear direction for local agencies. They will be backed up by new targets and performance indicators. A new qualification route for care workers is also to be established, through a learning disability awards framework.
